answers.answer: A1c is average Blood Sugar (BG)  A1c of 6.2 is equal to an average BG of 132.  so your BG could be as high as 220 and as low as 40 to AVERAGE to 132.Not only high BG causes eye problems but also large and frequent BG swings is also known to cause problems.Ask for a OGT test (Oral Glucose Tolerance) test  it will tell you how well your BG responds.

question: Hi I went to the eye Dr he told me I have retinal microaneurysms   he said the only thing that causes them is diabetes or high blood pressure my a1c is 6.2 I was never diagnosed with diabetes I have had some stress and some big spikes in blood pressure. Could an a1c of 6.2 still cause this?
title: retinal microaneurysm
